comment: He was a good professor. I had him for HON PHYS 2211L & HON PHYS 2212L. His report criteria was very clear and easy to follow. Everything you need is gone over in the slides. It's also in the lab booklets. I suggest putting a bit of effort in the reports to make it nice, but he suggests not spending too much time on the making of the report.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I really enjoyed having Dr. Basnet. I took him for both 2211 and 2212 and thoroughly enjoyed both classes. They are challenging but I feel Dr. Basnet does a great job ensuring the classes are engaging and interactive. He is super accessible outside of class and will go WAY out of his way to help you if you need it. I cannot recommend him enough.

he's genuinely passionate about the topic he teaches and wants students to learn. He'll answer any questions you have without making you feel dumb. He's flexible with the lab reports and asks the students what they're feeling about the assignments.

The content was not easy for me. There're lots of new and complex information but very interesting to learn about. That said, Dr. Basnet challenged me and helped me at the same time; he is probably one of the best teachers/professors I've ever had. You can tell he cares about the students performance in and outside of class. He's a great Professor.

Dr. Basnet is great and passionate about his work! He's always open and available to help you through problems you may have, and he grades very fairly. He cares about the people in his class and is unprecedentedly approachable when you want deeper information on topics in class. The content really helped me to understand the application of physics.

He was a great Professor! He wants students to succeed! iCliker questions are relatively easy as they're from the pre-lecture slides. Exams questions are all from the class materials and/or from review sessions. Do not memorize equations, a formula sheet will be provided with useful constants. If you are willing to put effort, you will be okay.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Basnet is very understanding and provides the class with extra credit opportunities. It's a PHYS Hon Lab course, and in addition to Physics concepts, I learned how to write a scientific lab report. ..If you follow the rubrics, you will be fine. I would re-take him. So, highly recommended!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Very Nice Professor! I took PHYS 2212 Hon course. Dr. Basnet wants you to succeed!! He was extremely helpful - even replied to my email twice over the weekend and helped me answer HW-related questions. If you want to learn, take him and there will be some extra opportunity for extra credit. Thanks! :-)

Dr. Basnet is very helpful, great at communication (both in person & via emails), and he has a desire to make his students learn/understand Physics. His passion for the class is there, and outside of class, I had some great talks with him when I was interested enough in the subject. He's caring, also try his best to raise the knowledge of students.

Dr. Basnet was a good physics professor who showed to care about his students. The lectures can be hard but if you follow what he says and have if you are good in math for solving problems you will be fine in his class.

No easy A in his class, but Dr. Basnet is always willing to help: if you try, you can! 3 midterms +1 final exam, with a lot of extra credit opportunity, you get credit even for your class note. Questions are all from HW or lecture slides. The beginning was a bit tough but I made a good progress (always 2 bonus questions, +20 pts)/ no way to fail.
